title: 8 Easy Ways to Fix reCAPTCHA Not Working in All Browsers

steps.title: Restart your computer to fix common errors.
steps.content: Restart your computer to fix common errors. In some cases, a quick restart can solve connection issues. Restart your computer , iPhone , or Android device . After restarting, try to load reCAPTCHA again.

steps.title: Make sure you're connected to Wi-Fi or a cellular network.
steps.content: Make sure you're connected to Wi-Fi or a cellular network. Slow connections can cause reCAPTCHA to freeze or load improperly. If needed, you can speed up a slow connection by minimizing the amount of programs or apps running in the background of your device. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: To use reCAPTCHA, you must use a supported browser.
steps.content: To use reCAPTCHA, you must use a supported browser. On desktop, you can use: Google Chrome , Mozilla Firefox , Safari, and Chromium Edge. On mobile, you can use: Google Chrome, Safari, and an Android native browser. [2] X Research source If you aren't using a listed browser, reopen the reCAPTCHA link in a supported browser.

steps.title: Keep your browser up-to-date
steps.content: Keep your browser up-to-date to avoid bugs. Open your browser's settings and look for any possible updates. If you have updates available, install them. [3] X Research source Restart your device after installing, and then try reCAPTCHA again.

steps.title: Turn off extensions and add-ons.
steps.content: Turn off extensions and add-ons. If you have extensions running on your browser, be sure to disable them if reCAPTCHA isn't working. Some extensions can interfere with how the page functions. This will vary depending on your browser, but you'll most likely find the option in Tools . [4] X Research source Restart your browser after deactivating extensions.

steps.title: Try a new IP address.
steps.content: Try a new IP address. In most cases, you can easily change your IP address by restarting your modem . Unplug your internet modem, wait a few minutes, and then plug it back in. [5] X Research source Once you're back online, try reCAPTCHA again.

steps.title: Make a new user profile on your computer.
steps.content: Make a new user profile on your computer. For Windows, this can be done in Settings → Accounts → Family & other users → Add someone else to this PC . Fill in the required fields. [6] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source For Mac, click the Apple menu → System Settings/Preferences → Users & Groups → Add Account . Select a user type, and then fill in the required fields. [7] X Research source Sign into the new user account, and then load reCAPTCHA again.

steps.title: Disable any active VPNs or proxy services.
steps.content: Disable any active VPNs or proxy services. Virtual Private Networks can interfere with your Wi-Fi or Bluetooth connection. Temporarily disable your VPN , then try to load reCAPTCHA again.
